div.div: ALL OF HUMANITY IN ONE FACEBOOK POST

div.a: The Real Joy Of The Powerball Facebook Fake

div.div: A man claims to be a Powerball winner and offers $1 million to anyone who shares the picture of him and his ticket. Almost 2 million share it. But it's the messages they leave that show humanity for what it is.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SniG8T&via=Digg&text=The Real Joy Of The Powerball Facebook Fake

div.a: Judge Refuses To Order 'Innocence Of Muslims' Off YouTube

div.div: An actress who said she was duped into appearing in an anti-Islam film that stoked violent protests against the United States across the Muslim world lost on Friday her second legal bid to force the video off YouTube.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WzWfNj&via=Digg&text=Judge Refuses To Order 'Innocence Of Muslims' Off YouTube

div.a: The History Of Nintendo Consoles In Two Minutes

div.div: Nintendo may not be what it once was back in its heyday, but you have to admit that in an industry where game publishers and developers can be here today and gone tomorrow, the company’s longevity says plenty.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TrSfNX&via=Digg&text=The History Of Nintendo Consoles In Two Minutes

div.a: First Same-Sex Couple Marries At West Point Chapel

div.div: A little more than a year after “Don't Ask, Don't Tell” ended, one of its key opponents weds her longtime partner at her alma mater.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YBUTXK&via=Digg&text=First Same-Sex Couple Marries At West Point Chapel

div.a: Head Of BitTorrent Jailed For 40 Months In Longest File-Sharing Sentence Ever

div.div: The lengthy sentence reflects Gregory Cherwonik's "sysop" status in the group, which the authorities said was higher in rank than other members that were handed 23- and 30-month jail terms earlier this month.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QxiVj8&via=Digg&text=Head Of BitTorrent Jailed For 40 Months In Longest File-Sharing Sentence Ever

div.a: 'Why I Love Twitter And Barely Tolerate Facebook'

div.div: "I’m optimistic and delighted every time I open up Twitter on my browser, while Facebook is something I only click on once or twice a day and always with a small sense of dread."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QvwhMK&via=Digg&text='Why I Love Twitter And Barely Tolerate Facebook'

div.div: SO CONTAGIOUS, BET YOU'RE YAWNING NOW

div.a: The Unsolved Mystery Of Why You Just Yawned

div.div: You might think that we would know why we yawn, but it has no obvious need, function or effect.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QVGfZa&via=Digg&text=The Unsolved Mystery Of Why You Just Yawned

div.a: The Most Famous Inventor You've Never Heard Of Has 3,300 Patents To His Name

div.div: “I am a cross between Steve Jobs and Leonardo da Vinci.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R2gxlA&via=Digg&text=The Most Famous Inventor You've Never Heard Of Has 3,300 Patents To His Name

div.a: Hypersonic Flight 'Breakthrough' Could Have Us In Tokyo By Lunch

div.div: A British company declares, with all due humility,that it has made “the biggest breakthrough in aerospace propulsion technology since the invention of the jet engine.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11stBBS&via=Digg&text=Hypersonic Flight 'Breakthrough' Could Have Us In Tokyo By Lunch

div.a: 10 Language Mistakes Kids Make That Are Actually Pretty Smart

div.div: Little kids make such cute mistakes when they talk so we tolerate their errors and chuckle at how funny they sound. In fact, kids’ mistakes show they know a lot more about the rules than we think.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11aRaA4&via=Digg&text=10 Language Mistakes Kids Make That Are Actually Pretty Smart

div.a: Flexible Phones Are Coming Sooner Than You Think

div.div: The first generation of flexible phones have already been prototyped.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tp9Shk&via=Digg&text=Flexible Phones Are Coming Sooner Than You Think

div.div: This eye-catching taxi designed to look like DeLorean time machine will take you "Back to the Future" or to any other destination.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Yh55pH&via=Digg&text=The DeLorean Taxi

div.a: Why You're Less Likely To Find A 'Made In China' Label On Your Shoes

div.div: The manufacturing behemoth that is the People’s Republic of China is seeing its lead shrink when it comes to exporting footwear to the US, as lower-cost countries such as Vietnam make inroads.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Tt1vRK&via=Digg&text=Why You're Less Likely To Find A 'Made In China' Label On Your Shoes

div.a: Why Is It Impossible To Stop Thinking?

div.div: Forgive your mind this minor annoyance because it has worked to save your life—or more accurately, the lives of your ancestors.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vd9XFb&via=Digg&text=Why Is It Impossible To Stop Thinking?

div.a: Business Lessons From A Former Gang Member

div.div: “The new guy in jail gets tested right away, usually by someone walking up and demanding their milk at lunch. If you give it away without a fight, you’ve got tough times ahead. The same thing goes on in business every day."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U6HdfG&via=Digg&text=Business Lessons From A Former Gang Member

div.div: ROBOTS WON'T STEAL YOUR JOB, YET

div.a: Amazon's Robotic Future: A Work In Progress

div.div: For all the anxiety over robots coming to take jobs, there are still limitations to what they can do—or what they can do well.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SukPkl&via=Digg&text=Amazon's Robotic Future: A Work In Progress

div.a: Life-Sized Chocolate Baby Heads Are This Season's Creepiest Confection

div.div: Want to keep yourself from overindulging in sweets this holiday season? Every time you pick up a piece of chocolate, imagine on of these creepy things staring up at you.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VlW3ps&via=Digg&text=Life-Sized Chocolate Baby Heads Are This Season's Creepiest Confection

div.div: Using gold, old maps, roots, threads and embroidery, Dutch artist Anne Ten Donkelaar repairs the fragmented wings and bodies of butterflies recovered from the Hortus Botanicus Butterfly Garden in Amsterdam.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TrzZUV&via=Digg&text=Fixed It! Broken Butterflies Rebuilt

div.a: What New York City Would Look Like Buried In Its Own Carbon Emissions

div.div: Imagine if carbon wasn’t a formless gas, but rather a solid ball. We’d be forced to deal with our emissions problem much faster, because look at what would happen to New York as the carbon piled up.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SkED8k&via=Digg&text=What New York City Would Look Like Buried In Its Own Carbon Emissions

div.div: FACEBOOK PICTURES WILL STILL BE CACHED

div.a: The Aliens Will Find This Time-Capsule When All The Humans Are Gone

div.div: Billions of years from now, when the earth has erased all traces of our stay here, hundreds of dead satellites will remain in orbit around the earth. Along with these pictures.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11qZ1bK&via=Digg&text=The Aliens Will Find This Time-Capsule When All The Humans Are Gone

div.div: In this showcase, Reuters photographers offer a behind the scenes account of the images that helped define the year.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TytphZ&via=Digg&text=Best Photos Of 2012
